title: [K-12] Adaptive Learning Design for C Programming Language: Cognitive Load Optimization Using Dual-Mode Task Examples

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic programming concepts and experience in simple algorithm design
context.additional_context: Learners independently access asynchronous learning modules 2-3 times weekly, with one monthly live tutoring session provided

learning_goals: Design intermediate-level programs utilizing core C language syntax (pointers, memory management, structures)
Solve problems by selecting Worked-Out Examples (WOEs) tailored to individual cognitive load levels through an adaptive learning system
Derive and explain efficient learning strategies through comparative analysis of dual-mode (visual+text) Worked-Out Examples
Adjust learning pathways based on individual diagnostic results measured through formative assessments

resources: Integrated Development Environment (IDE) for C Compiler

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
